data.name: SARIF1001_Default
data.value: {0}: The name and id properties of rule "{1}" are the same.

data.name: SARIF1001_DoNotUseFriendlyNameAsRuleIdDescription
data.value: Do not use the same string for a rule's id and name properties. The id property must be a stable, opaque identifer such as "SARIF1001". The name property should be a string that is understandable to an end user, such as "DoNotUserFriendlyNameAsRuleId".

data.name: SARIF1003_Default
data.value: {0}: The string "{1}" is not a valid URI reference.

data.name: SARIF1003_UrisMustBeValid
data.value: Specify a valid URI reference for every URI-valued property.

data.name: SARIF1006_Default
data.value: {0}: The array contains multiple objects with the value "{1}" for the algorithm property.

data.name: SARIF1006_HashAlgorithmsMustBeUnique
data.value: In any given "file" object, every element of the "hashes" array must have a different value for its "algorithm" property.

data.name: SARIF1007_Default
data.value: {0}: The end time "{1}" is before the start time "{2}".

data.name: SARIF1007_EndTimeMustNotBeBeforeStartTime
data.value: The end time of a run must not precede the start time. To allow for the possibility that the duration of the run is less than the resolution of the string representation of the time, the start time and the end time may be equal.

data.name: SARIF1008_Default
data.value: {0}: The message "{1}" does not end with a period.

data.name: SARIF1008_MessagesShouldEndWithPeriod
data.value: Messages should consist of one or more complete sentences, ending with a period.

data.name: SARIF1009_InvalidStepValue
data.value: {0}: The value of the "step" property should be {1}, but is {2}. The step values must form a 1-based sequence starting at the first threadFlowLocation in the thread flow.

data.name: SARIF1009_StepNotPresentOnAllLocations
data.value: {0}: The "step" property is absent. The "step" property is present on some but not all threadFlowLocations in this threadFlow. If the "step" property is used on any threadFlowLocation in a threadFlow, it must be present on every threadFlowLocation in that threadFlow.

data.name: SARIF1009_StepValuesMustFormOneBasedSequence
data.value: If the "step" property is used on any threadFlowLocation in a threadFlow, then it must be present for every threadFlowLocation in the threadFlow, its value must be 1 for the first threadFlowLocation, and its value must increase by 1 for each succeeding threadFlowLocation.

data.name: SARIF1012_Default
data.value: {0}: The value of the "endLine" property is {1}, which is less than the value of the "startLine" property, which is {2}.

data.name: SARIF1012_EndLineMustNotBeLessThanStartLine
data.value: The "endLine" property of a region object must not be less than the "startLine" property.

data.name: SARIF1013_Default
data.value: {0}: The value of the "endColumn" property is {1}, which is less than the value of the "startColumn" property, which is {2}.

data.name: SARIF1013_EndColumnMustNotBeLessThanStartColumn
data.value: The "endColumn" property of a region object must not be less than the "startColumn" property.

data.name: SARIF1014_Default
data.value: {0}: This fileLocation object contains a "uriBaseId" property, which means that the value of the "uri" property must be a relative URI reference, but "{1}" is an absolute URI reference.

data.name: SARIF1014_UriBaseIdRequiresRelativeUri
data.value: If a fileLocation object contains a "uriBaseId" property, the value of the "uri" property must be a relative URI reference.

data.name: SARIF1015_Default
data.value: {0}: The value of this property is required to be an absolute URI, but "{1}" is a relative URI reference.

data.name: SARIF1015_UriMustBeAbsolute
data.value: Certain URIs are required to be absolute.

data.name: SARIF1016_ContextRegionRequiresRegion
data.value: If the "contextRegion" property is present, the "region" property must also be present.

data.name: SARIF1016_Default
data.value: {0}: This "physicalLocation" object contains a "contextRegion" property, but it does not contain a "region" property.

data.name: SARIF1017_Default
data.value: {0}: This "{1}" object contains a property "{2}" with value {3}, but either "{4}" is absent, or it has fewer than {5} elements.

data.name: SARIF1017_InvalidIndex
data.value: If an object contains a property that is used as an array index, then that array must be present and must contain at least "index + 1" elements.

data.name: SARIF1018_InvalidUriInOriginalUriBaseIds
data.value: In the artifactLocation objects contained in run.originalUriBaseIds, if uriBaseId is absent, then uri must either be an absolute URI or it must be absent. Also, uri must end with a slash, so that it can safely be combined with the relative URIs in artifactLocation objects elsewhere in the log file.

data.name: SARIF1018_LacksTrailingSlash
data.value: {0}: The URI '{1}' belonging to the '{2}' element of run.originalUriBaseIds does not end with a slash.

data.name: SARIF1018_NotAbsolute
data.value: {0}: The URI '{1}' belonging to the '{2}' element of run.originalUriBaseIds is not an absolute URI.

data.name: SARIF1019_InconsistentResultRuleId
data.value: {0}: The result contains both the ruleId property '{1}' and the rule.id property '{2}', and they are not equal.

data.name: SARIF1019_MissingResultRuleId
data.value: {0}: The result contains neither result.ruleId nor result.rule.id.

data.name: SARIF1019_RuleIdMustBePresentAndConsistent
data.value: In every result, at least one of the properties result.ruleId and result.rule.id must be present. If both are present, they must be equal.

data.name: SARIF1020_ReferenceToOldSchemaVersion
data.value: {0}: The $schema property value '{1}' does not refer to the final version of the SARIF 2.1.0 schema. If you are using an earlier version of the SARIF format, consider upgrading your analysis tool to produce the final version. If this file does in fact conform to the final version of the schema, upgrade the tool to populate the $schema property with a URL that refers to the final version of the schema.

data.name: SARIF1020_ReferToFinalSchema
data.value: The $schema property should be present, and must refer to the final version of the SARIF 2.1.0 schema. This enables IDEs to provide Intellisense for SARIF log files.

data.name: SARIF1020_SchemaReferenceMissing
data.value: {0}: The SARIF log file does not contain a $schema property. Add a $schema property that refers to the final version of the SARIF 2.1.0 schema. This enables IDEs to provide Intellisense for SARIF log files.
